  16. (** Source code locations (ranges of positions), used in parsetree.

  18.   {b Warning:} this module is unstable and part of
  19.   {{!Compiler_libs}compiler-libs}.

  21. *)

  23. open Format

  25. ‌type t = Warnings.loc = {
  26.   loc_start: Lexing.position;
  27.   loc_end: Lexing.position;
  28.   loc_ghost: bool;
  29. }

  31. (** Note on the use of Lexing.position in this module.
  32.    If [pos_fname = ""], then use [!input_name] instead.
  33.    If [pos_lnum = -1], then [pos_bol = 0]. Use [pos_cnum] and
  34.      re-parse the file to get the line and character numbers.
  35.    Else all fields are correct.
  36. *)

  38. ‌val none : t
  39. (** An arbitrary value of type [t]; describes an empty ghost range. *)

  41. ‌val is_none : t -> bool
  42. (** True for [Location.none], false any other location *)

  44. ‌val in_file : string -> t
  45. (** Return an empty ghost range located in a given file. *)

  48. (** Set the file name and line number of the [lexbuf] to be the start
  49.     of the named file. *)

  51. ‌val curr : Lexing.lexbuf -> t
  52. (** Get the location of the current token from the [lexbuf]. *)

  95. (** {1 Rewriting path } *)

  97. ‌val rewrite_absolute_path: string -> string
  98. (** [rewrite_absolute_path path] rewrites [path] to honor the
  99.     BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP variable
  100.     if it is set. It does not check whether [path] is absolute or not.
  101.     The result is as follows:
  102.     - If BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP is not set, just return [path].
  103.     - otherwise, rewrite using the mapping (and if there are no
  104.       matching prefixes that will just return [path]).

  106.     See
  107.     {{: https://reproducible-builds.org/specs/build-path-prefix-map/ }
  108.     the BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP spec}
  109.     *)

  111. ‌val rewrite_find_first_existing: string -> string option
  112. (** [rewrite_find_first_existing path] uses a BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP mapping
  113.     and tries to find a source in mapping
  114.     that maps to a result that exists in the file system.
  115.     There are the following return values:
  116.     - [None], means either
  117.       {ul {- BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP is not set and [path] does not exists, or}
  118.           {- no source prefixes of [path] in the mapping were found,}}
  119.     - [Some target], means [target] exists and either
  120.       {ul {- BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP is not set and [target] = [path], or}
  121.           {- [target] is the first file (in priority
  122.              order) that [path] mapped to that exists in the file system.}}
  123.     - [Not_found] raised, means some source prefixes in the map
  124.       were found that matched [path], but none of them existed
  125.       in the file system. The caller should catch this and issue
  126.       an appropriate error message.

  128.     See
  129.     {{: https://reproducible-builds.org/specs/build-path-prefix-map/ }
  130.     the BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP spec}
  131.     *)

  133. ‌val rewrite_find_all_existing_dirs: string -> string list
  134. (** [rewrite_find_all_existing_dirs dir] accumulates a list of existing
  135.     directories, [dirs], that are the result of mapping a potentially
  136.     abstract directory, [dir], over all the mapping pairs in the
  137.     BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP environment variable, if any. The list [dirs]
  138.     will be in priority order (head as highest priority).

  140.     The possible results are:
  141.     - [[]], means either
  142.       {ul {- BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP is not set and [dir] is not an existing
  143.       directory, or}
  144.           {- if set, then there were no matching prefixes of [dir].}}
  145.     - [Some dirs], means dirs are the directories found. Either
  146.       {ul {- BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP is not set and [dirs = [dir]], or}
  147.           {- it was set and [dirs] are the mapped existing directories.}}
  148.     - Not_found raised, means some source prefixes in the map
  149.       were found that matched [dir], but none of mapping results
  150.       were existing directories (possibly due to misconfiguration).
  151.       The caller should catch this and issue an appropriate error
  152.       message.

  154.     See
  155.     {{: https://reproducible-builds.org/specs/build-path-prefix-map/ }
  156.     the BUILD_PATH_PREFIX_MAP spec}
  157.     *)

  159. ‌val absolute_path: string -> string
  160. (** [absolute_path path] first makes an absolute path, [s] from [path],
  161.      prepending the current working directory if [path] was relative.
  162.      Then [s] is rewritten using [rewrite_absolute_path].
  163.      Finally the result is normalized by eliminating instances of
  164.      ['.'] or ['..']. *)

  166. (** {1 Printing locations} *)

  168. ‌val show_filename: string -> string
  169.     (** In -absname mode, return the absolute path for this filename.
  170.         Otherwise, returns the filename unchanged. *)

  172. ‌val print_filename: formatter -> string -> unit

  174. ‌val print_loc: formatter -> t -> unit
  175. ‌val print_locs: formatter -> t list -> unit

  184. (** {1 Reporting errors and warnings} *)

  186. (** {2 The type of reports and report printers} *)

  188. ‌type msg = (Format.formatter -> unit) loc

  190. ‌val msg: ?loc:t -> ('a, Format.formatter, unit, msg) format4 -> 'a

  192. ‌type report_kind =
  193.   | Report_error
  194.   | Report_warning of string
  195.   | Report_warning_as_error of string
  196.   | Report_alert of string
  197.   | Report_alert_as_error of string

  199. ‌type report = {
  200.   kind : report_kind;
  201.   main : msg;
  202.   sub : msg list;
  203. }

  205. ‌type report_printer = {
  206.   (* The entry point *)
  207.   pp : report_printer ->
  208.     Format.formatter -> report -> unit;

  210.   pp_report_kind : report_printer -> report ->
  211.     Format.formatter -> report_kind -> unit;
  212.   pp_main_loc : report_printer -> report ->
  213.     Format.formatter -> t -> unit;
  214.   pp_main_txt : report_printer -> report ->
  215.     Format.formatter -> (Format.formatter -> unit) -> unit;
  216.   pp_submsgs : report_printer -> report ->
  217.     Format.formatter -> msg list -> unit;
  218.   pp_submsg : report_printer -> report ->
  219.     Format.formatter -> msg -> unit;
  220.   pp_submsg_loc : report_printer -> report ->
  221.     Format.formatter -> t -> unit;
  222.   pp_submsg_txt : report_printer -> report ->
  223.     Format.formatter -> (Format.formatter -> unit) -> unit;
  224. }
  225. (** A printer for [report]s, defined using open-recursion.
  226.     The goal is to make it easy to define new printers by re-using code from
  227.     existing ones.
  228. *)

  230. (** {2 Report printers used in the compiler} *)

  232. ‌val batch_mode_printer: report_printer

  234. ‌val terminfo_toplevel_printer: Lexing.lexbuf -> report_printer

  236. ‌val best_toplevel_printer: unit -> report_printer
  237. (** Detects the terminal capabilities and selects an adequate printer *)

  239. (** {2 Printing a [report]} *)

  241. ‌val print_report: formatter -> report -> unit
  242. (** Display an error or warning report. *)

  244. ‌val report_printer: (unit -> report_printer) ref
  245. (** Hook for redefining the printer of reports.

  247.     The hook is a [unit -> report_printer] and not simply a [report_printer]:
  248.     this is useful so that it can detect the type of the output (a file, a
  249.     terminal, ...) and select a printer accordingly. *)

  251. ‌val default_report_printer: unit -> report_printer
  252. (** Original report printer for use in hooks. *)


  255. (** {1 Reporting warnings} *)

  257. (** {2 Converting a [Warnings.t] into a [report]} *)

  259. ‌val report_warning: t -> Warnings.t -> report option
  260. (** [report_warning loc w] produces a report for the given warning [w], or
  261.    [None] if the warning is not to be printed. *)

  263. ‌val warning_reporter: (t -> Warnings.t -> report option) ref
  264. (** Hook for intercepting warnings. *)

  266. ‌val default_warning_reporter: t -> Warnings.t -> report option
  267. (** Original warning reporter for use in hooks. *)

  269. (** {2 Printing warnings} *)

  271. ‌val formatter_for_warnings : formatter ref

  273. ‌val print_warning: t -> formatter -> Warnings.t -> unit
  274. (** Prints a warning. This is simply the composition of [report_warning] and
  275.    [print_report]. *)

  277. ‌val prerr_warning: t -> Warnings.t -> unit
  278. (** Same as [print_warning], but uses [!formatter_for_warnings] as output
  279.    formatter. *)

  281. (** {1 Reporting alerts} *)

  283. (** {2 Converting an [Alert.t] into a [report]} *)

  285. ‌val report_alert: t -> Warnings.alert -> report option
  286. (** [report_alert loc w] produces a report for the given alert [w], or
  287.    [None] if the alert is not to be printed. *)

  289. ‌val alert_reporter: (t -> Warnings.alert -> report option) ref
  290. (** Hook for intercepting alerts. *)

  292. ‌val default_alert_reporter: t -> Warnings.alert -> report option
  293. (** Original alert reporter for use in hooks. *)

  295. (** {2 Printing alerts} *)

  297. ‌val print_alert: t -> formatter -> Warnings.alert -> unit
  298. (** Prints an alert. This is simply the composition of [report_alert] and
  299.    [print_report]. *)

  301. ‌val prerr_alert: t -> Warnings.alert -> unit
  302. (** Same as [print_alert], but uses [!formatter_for_warnings] as output
  303.    formatter. *)

  305. ‌val deprecated: ?def:t -> ?use:t -> t -> string -> unit
  306. (** Prints a deprecation alert. *)

  308. ‌val alert: ?def:t -> ?use:t -> kind:string -> t -> string -> unit
  309. (** Prints an arbitrary alert. *)

  311. ‌val auto_include_alert: string -> unit
  312. (** Prints an alert that -I +lib has been automatically added to the load
  313.     path *)

  315. ‌val deprecated_script_alert: string -> unit
  316. (** [deprecated_script_alert command] prints an alert that [command foo] has
  317.     been deprecated in favour of [command ./foo] *)

  319. (** {1 Reporting errors} *)

  321. ‌type error = report
  322. (** An [error] is a [report] which [report_kind] must be [Report_error]. *)

  324. ‌val error: ?loc:t -> ?sub:msg list -> string -> error

  326. ‌val errorf: ?loc:t -> ?sub:msg list ->
  327.   ('a, Format.formatter, unit, error) format4 -> 'a

  329. ‌val error_of_printer: ?loc:t -> ?sub:msg list ->
  330.   (formatter -> 'a -> unit) -> 'a -> error

  332. ‌val error_of_printer_file: (formatter -> 'a -> unit) -> 'a -> error


  335. (** {1 Automatically reporting errors for raised exceptions} *)

  337. ‌val register_error_of_exn: (exn -> error option) -> unit
  338. (** Each compiler module which defines a custom type of exception
  339.     which can surface as a user-visible error should register
  340.     a "printer" for this exception using [register_error_of_exn].
  341.     The result of the printer is an [error] value containing
  342.     a location, a message, and optionally sub-messages (each of them
  343.     being located as well). *)

  345. ‌val error_of_exn: exn -> [ `Ok of error | `Already_displayed ] option

  347. exception Error of error
  348. (** Raising [Error e] signals an error [e]; the exception will be caught and the
  349.    error will be printed. *)

  351. exception Already_displayed_error
  352. (** Raising [Already_displayed_error] signals an error which has already been
  353.    printed. The exception will be caught, but nothing will be printed *)

  355. ‌val raise_errorf: ?loc:t -> ?sub:msg list ->
  356.   ('a, Format.formatter, unit, 'b) format4 -> 'a

  358. ‌val report_exception: formatter -> exn -> unit
  359. (** Reraise the exception if it is unknown. *)
